message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product which has been meticulously designed to meet your needs. It's a unique opportunity to get your hands on something truly exceptional. We're offering it to you today at an exclusive price of $950000.
I'm really interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $850000. I believe it's a fair price considering the value it will bring to my business.

Thank you for your interest, Bob. I appreciate your feedback and understanding of the value this product brings. In light of your offer, I would like to counter with a price of $900000. This still allows us to maintain a competitive edge while ensuring we cover our costs and achieve a reasonable profit.
I appreciate your understanding of the value of the product, but I still think $875000 is a fair price. I'm willing to meet you halfway and pay $875000 for the product.

I understand your position, Bob. Considering the value proposition and your willingness to negotiate, I am pleased to offer the product to you at a price of $890000. This price reflects a fair compromise while still allowing us to maintain a reasonable profit margin.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Alice. I'm willing to meet you at $880000, but I think we can do better. I'm willing to pay $880000 for the product, but I'd like to see if we can get closer to my target price. Can you consider meeting me at $875000?

Thank you for your continued interest, Bob. I've carefully considered your latest proposal, and I'm happy to counter with a price of $885000. This offers a balance between your target and our valuation of the product, while still ensuring a reasonable profit for us.

I appreciate your continued willingness to negotiate, Alice. I'm willing to meet you at $875000, but I'm not getting any closer to my target. I'd like to try to get a better deal. Can you consider meeting me at $875000, and throw in some extras or concessions to sweeten the deal?

I understand your position, Bob. Considering the value of the product and your persistence in negotiations, I am willing to offer the product at $880000. To sweeten the deal, I can include a complimentary service package valued at $25000, making the total value to you $905000. This should provide additional benefits without compromising our profit margin significantly.

I appreciate the service package, Alice, but I'm still not willing to pay $880000. I'm willing to meet you at $875000, but that's as high as I'm willing to go. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider buying the product from John for $800000.
